column4: is there a way for me to change encoding on a textfile from windows to something that pdflatex might agree to?
you can use iconv to change encodings
do i have to know what encoding it was?
yes you have to know what encoding it was. what kind of file is it?
its a tex file, i made it and my partner edited it in windows notepad and now it gives me an error when i try to latexpdf
actually its all the tex files in the project:P
what error? it might just be the 'newlines' which you can strip with dos2unix  (apt-get install tofrodos)
did your buddy use any non-ascii characters like french letters?
windows notepad probably saves in utf8 in modern windows. if you give me file i can try to detect encoding
no, but we write in norwegian, and we got a tips to change to \usepackage[ansinew]{inputenc}, but then it didnt take æøå
what is the exact command line you are feeding to your tex program?
when it crash? its this line "TGF (Terrestrial Gamma ray Flash, eller gammaglimt fra jorden på norsk) er gammastråler som har " and it dont like æøå
what command line are you using to feed to tex?
pdflatex myfile.tex ?
yes
i cant seem to get dcc workign with pidgin but maybe this will help http://www.linuxhowtos.org/Tips%20and%20Tricks/latexuf8.htm?ref=news.rdf
basically i would google around for utf8 and pdflatex ... many people ahve the same problem
when i used \usepackage[utf8x]{inputenc} it worked:)
n o problem. that will be $100
i'll write u a check;)
